I went through a little bit of the discussion. Given the current session implementation does not support dynamic partitioning of the graph, following the design of MonitoredSession, one proposed solution could be:

  1. Prepare for a scaling by writing a checkpoint to external storage
  2. Terminate current session
  3. Re-do the partitioning of graph with respect to the new cluster_def
  4. Create a new session and recover from the checkpoint

body:
I went through a little bit of the discussion. Given the current session implementation does not support dynamic partitioning of the graph, following the design of `MonitoredSession`, one proposed solution could be:

1. Prepare for a scaling by writing a checkpoint to external storage
2. Terminate current session
3. Re-do the partitioning of graph with respect to the new cluster_def
4. Create a new session and recover from the checkpoint
